title: How to read books on Goodreads - Quora

response.answer_text: Goodreads doesn’t provide you with books, it’s just a place where you can track what books you want to read, what books you’ve read, write reviews for the ones you’ve read, and get recommendations for other books you would probably like to read. If you’re looking for places where you can read books for free, I recommend: borrowing from your local library,overdrive, for your local library’s ebook collection,OpenLibrary.org (read scanned books online),and if you enjoy the classics, look for them in amazon’s Kindle store: most classics are available for free as kindle books.Oh, I just remembered, Goodreads does host giveaways! These are usually books by new authors, and there is no guarantee that you’ll win the draw, but it doesn’t hurt to enter if you’re interested. In any case, the reading will take place elsewhere (at home with a physical book, or one of those ebook options), and you just track your reading on Goodreads. I hope that helps!
